describe: Dominica, known as the 'Nature Isle of the Caribbean', is a mountainous island nation in the Lesser Antilles. It is renowned for its lush rainforests, hot springs, and the world's second-largest boiling lake. The island is a haven for eco-tourism and adventure seekers.

cities.name: üèù Roseau
cities.geographical_location: Located on the southwestern coast of Dominica, Roseau is the capital and largest city of the island.
cities.climate: Roseau has a tropical rainforest climate with consistent temperatures year-round and a wet season from June to November.
cities.famous_cuisine: Mountain chicken (frog legs), callaloo soup, and codfish sandwiches.

cities.name: üèù Portsmouth
cities.geographical_location: Situated in the northwestern part of Dominica, Portsmouth is the second-largest town on the island.
cities.climate: Portsmouth experiences a tropical rainforest climate with high humidity and significant rainfall throughout the year.
cities.famous_cuisine: Crab backs, coconut dumplings, and fish broth.
